# iosxe_interface_isis (Resource)

This resource can manage the Interface ISIS configuration.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "iosxe_interface_isis" "example" {
  type = "Loopback"
  name = "100"
  ipv4_metric_levels = [
    {
      level = "level-1"
      value = 100
    }
  ]
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String)
- `type` (String) Interface type
  - Choices: `GigabitEthernet`, `TwoGigabitEthernet`, `FiveGigabitEthernet`, `TenGigabitEthernet`, `TwentyFiveGigE`, `FortyGigabitEthernet`, `HundredGigE`, `TwoHundredGigE`, `FourHundredGigE`, `Loopback`, `Vlan`, `Port-channel`, `Port-channel-subinterface/Port-channel`, `Tunnel`

### Optional

- `delete_mode` (String) Configure behavior when deleting/destroying the resource. Either delete the entire object (YANG container) being managed, or only delete the individual resource attributes configured explicitly and leave everything else as-is. Default value is `all`.
  - Choices: `all`, `attributes`
- `device` (String) A device name from the provider configuration.
- `ipv4_metric_levels` (Attributes List) Configure IS-IS metric for interface (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--ipv4_metric_levels))

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The path of the object.

<a id="nestedatt--ipv4_metric_levels"></a>
### Nested Schema for `ipv4_metric_levels`

Required:

- `level` (String) IS-IS level (level-1 or level-2)
  - Choices: `level-1`, `level-2`
- `value` (Number) Metric value (1-16777214)
  - Range: `1`-`16777214`

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
terraform import iosxe_interface_isis.example "<type>,<name>"
```
